headline.main: CANCER SUIT BY URANIUM MINERS HEARD IN ARIZONA

docs.lead_paragraph: Testimony concluded here Monday in a $30 million civil damage suit brought against the Federal Government in behalf of 85 Navajo uranium miners or their survivors. The plaintiffs contend that the Government failed to safeguard the miners from heavy doses of radiation in the 1950's, when the mining was part of a nuclear weapons manufacturing program. At the four-week Federal Court trial, conducted without a jury, nationally prominent physicians testified for both sides. No verdict is expected for several months.
